item.title: Engine Indication and Crew Alerting Systems (EICAS) – Computer

remarks.para: Except for ER operations, one may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Standby Engine Instruments are operative and are turned ON,
Electronic Engine Control or autothrottle system is operative,
At least one autopilot is operative,
SB 757-71-5 or equivalent, engine EGT interconnection, is installed (RR Engine only),
Both Display Units are operative, and
Repair or replacements are made within one flight day.

note.para: In event of an additional computer failure en route, flight crew should consider landing as soon as practical.

numlitem.para: Before takeoff, with engines running, compare engine display on EICAS with the Standby Engine Instrument. The EICAS/SEI engine display cross-compare tolerances are as follows:
Dispatch is prohibited if tolerances are exceeded.
Power setting for takeoff must be made with EICAS.
Use SEI to observe engine parameters.
Prior to descent, scan overhead panel for possible non-normal indications.

note.para: With EICAS computer C/B pulled, FMC calculated fuel is unavailable.

placard.para: Placard affected position of the Computer Select Switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: With one computer inoperative, test the operative computer as follows:
Set parking brake ON, in order to enable the EICAS test function.
Set computer select switch to operative computer. Press TEST switch on maintenance panel, P61, checking for "SELF TEST Complete" "0 External Faults and 0 Internal Faults" message on EICAS.
Pull and collar the circuit breaker for the affected computer as follows: Inoperative computer – L (P11J2) or R (P11J29) EICAS COMPUTER.
